item.title: Report E-2024120296
item.description:
Report E-2024120296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 17, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3266 had a faulty lid and released approximately ten (10) ounces of product to the tote's exterior and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing agents and absorbents to remove all UN3266 from the scene. Hand tools were used to containerized all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120980
item.description:
Report X-2024120980

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS FACILITY ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED VIBRATING AND MAKING A LOUD NOISE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE ORBIT ELECTRIC SANDER WITH THE BATTERY ATTACHED THAT HAD ACTIVATED DURING TRANSPORTATION. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS ONE MILWAUKEE GRINDER WITH THE BATTERY ATTACHED. THE DEVICES HAVE NOT BEEN SECURED AGAINST MOVEMENT WITHIN THE OUTER PACKAGING OR PACKED TO PREVENT ACCIDENTAL ACTIVATION AND CONTACT WITH OTHER PIECES OF EQUIPMENT. ADDITIONALLY, TWO FLAMMABLE AEROSOL CANS OF TRU-GALV SILVER GALVANIZING COMPOUND AT 14-OUNCE ARE ALSO INSIDE THE BOX. LITHIUM BATTERIES AND CELLS ARE NOT AUTHORIZED TO BE PACKED IN THE SAME OUTER PACKAGING WITH FLAMMABLE GASES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. PRIOR TO DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM MDT TO RFD.

item.title: Report X-2024121192
item.description:
Report X-2024121192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-14
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP AND RMP DIRECTED RESPONDER TO BAY 462. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON, SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED DECISION TREE, WHICH LED TO FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET BECAUSE THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL ON ONE SIDE. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED PACKAGE. RESPONDER ALSO CLEANED UP REMAINS FROM THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024121246
item.description:
Report X-2024121246

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-02
  • City: MARION
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE INSPECTION OF ONE AIR PACKAGE, WE DISCOVERED AN INNER BOX MARKED AND LABELED UN1018, CHLORODIFLUOROMETHANE WITH A NON-FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL. THE BOX CONTAINED A 30 LB NET WEIGHT REFRIGERANT COMPRESSED CYLINDER THAT WEIGHS APPROXIMATELY 40 LBS. THERMAL LABEL PACKAGE WEIGHT IS INCORRECTLY SHOWN AS 30 LBS. OUTER BOX HAS A SINGLE ORIENTATION ARROW ON OPPOSITE SIDES, ONE BEING PARTIALLY COVERED BY THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF IN CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER XX4527, NORTH STATE RENDERING, 15 SHIPPEE RD, OROVILLE, CA 95965-9297.

item.title: Report E-2024120358
item.description:
Report E-2024120358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the drum being damaged. The release material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. One (1) 95-gallon poly drum was also used to contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120363
item.description:
Report E-2024120363

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 10:56 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a spill at terminal XSW. Approximately one cup of SETALUX 17-1291 was released from one 55-gallon metal drum, impacting the drum's top because of a loose cap. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, and the caller determined that terminal staff are capable of cleaning the release with PPE on-site. Terminal personnel placed impacted absorbents with Setalux 17-1291 in 5-gallon poly drum.
